body:
Hi Rob,

Rob Guglielmetti wrote:
Well, I've been known to be a bit of a curmudgeon myself....
particularly on this topic
No and I would suggest that real BIM is completely disruptive, so it
going to be interesting. And I am trying to consider how this technology
might be useful for us, not close to any answers at all though.
Yeah, I have never really understood the layering standards (not that I
ever paid much attention to them). We have always tried to be pretty
functional in terms of naming conventions (glass-vision, glass-frit,
int-wall, int-ceil ....), it just make the layers more intelligible at
least for our needs.
Hmm, well I will be interested to hear more about this. I guess my
recent experience with the tool make me feel like washing my hands (but
this has more to do with a big ugly model than anything else)... I still
have my evaluation going so I should do some experiments on real models.

I think bigger picture though, the real intermediate file format for
better or worse is obj, the main problem with this in my mind is then
loosing out on selected Radiance primitives such as spheres, cylinders,
and polygons of vertices > 4... as well as having more potential issues
controlling tessellations of geometry that must NOT be tessellated such
as geometry being used in any illum source location.
